body_html: @sytrus-in-github thank you for the flip function. How would I have to adapt it to get a[..., ::-1, :] for the matrix a[batch_size, x_size, y_size]. I would need to flip x and y, and leave the batch dimension untouched (full example).
body_text: @sytrus-in-github thank you for the flip function. How would I have to adapt it to get a[..., ::-1, :] for the matrix a[batch_size, x_size, y_size]. I would need to flip x and y, and leave the batch dimension untouched (full example).
body: @sytrus-in-github thank you for the flip function. How would I have to adapt it to get `a[..., ::-1, :]` for the matrix `a[batch_size, x_size, y_size]`. I would need to flip x and y, and leave the batch dimension untouched ([full example](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/optimizing-diagonal-stripe-code/17777/16)).
